total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation of the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is three times the size of the input grid in both dimensions.
Q3: Observe that every cell in the input grid is replicated three times in both dimensions in the output grid.

Q4: Identify the rule for transforming the value of each cell in the input grid to the corresponding cells in the output grid. Notice that 0s in the input grid are transformed to 2s in the first cell of each 3x3 block in the output grid.
Q5: Apply the transformation rule identified in Q4 to each cell in the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation of the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is three times the size of the input grid in both dimensions.
Q3: Observe that the original input grid is repeated three times both horizontally and vertically to form the output grid.
Q4: Notice that a '2' is added at the start of each row and column in the output grid, except for the first row and column.
Q5: Apply these transformations to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.

Q3: Observe that every cell in the input grid is replicated three times in both dimensions in the output grid.

Q4: Identify the rule for transforming the value of each cell in the input grid to the corresponding cells in the output grid. Notice that 0s in the input grid are transformed to 2s in the output grid, and other numbers are kept the same.
Q5: Apply the transformation rule to each cell in the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
